definition: a younger branch of a family or a member of it
one in training for a military or naval commission, a student in a service academy
a student at a police academy : a person who is in training to become a police officer
examples: During his swearing-in speech last August, the 54-year-old head cop pointed out that he still wears the same size uniform that he wore when he was a cadet at the Police Academy 34 years ago.

definition: a student at a police academy : a person who is in training to become a police officer
examples: Police departments typically require cadets to pass a fitness test at the police academy, but not many require officers to stay in shape after that.
